result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley B McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Harley B McDaniel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Harley B McDaniel was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Harley B McDaniel was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 4-11-17; unpaid court obligations of $647.90 and supervision fees of $320

Defendant Harley B McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the 
State of Wisconsin.  Revocation Warrant received.  Joint recommendation.  Court imposed on Ct 2:  90 days jail,  Ct 3:  9 months jail concurrent to Ct 2.  This case is concurrent to Sauk County case 16CF144.  May transfer to Sauk County.  Jail credit 198 days.  Civil judgment $647.90 entered.   3:21 PM/3:33pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Probation Agent Sarah Greiger
Ron Benavides
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by Attorney Ryan Frank
Filed by Attorney Ryan Frank

Cases called:  14CM218, 14CM172 & 15CM321, Defendant Harley B McDaniel in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3 in 15CM321. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 2 yrs. probation, conds:   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete anger management counseling/treatment. Maintain full time employment, school or treatment or combination. $443, $243 costs. DNA sample. Defendant may terminate probation after 18 months if  probation complied with if agent agrees and Court grants. May expunge after 18 months if probation completed and no law violations. Six month review. 15 CM321 cts. 1&4 dismissed. 14CM172 dismissed. 14CM218 read in and dismissed. 7 days jail credit. 20 days jail imposed if defendant has alcohol or illicit drugs in his system today. Sentence commence forth with. Jail credit to be applied to jail sentence.
plea and sentence at 03-29-2016 02:45 pm
